tit.e: Tsukida no oka (the Imperial Mausoleum of the Emperor Suizei in Nara Prefecture)

sen.j: 衝田岡（つきだのおか）は奈良県橿原市四条町字田ノ坪に所在する綏靖天皇の陵墓。
sen.e: Tsukida no oka is the imperial mausoleum of the Emperor Suizei located in Azatanotsubo, Shijo Town, Kashihara City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 衝田岡とは、古事記中巻による。
sen.e: Tsukida no oka is originated in the middle volume of Kojiki (the Records of Ancient Matters).

sen.j: 日本書紀によれば、陵名は畝傍山東北陵。
sen.e: According to Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan), the name of the imperial mausoleum is Unebi no yama no Ushitora no Misasagi.

sen.j: 延喜式では、大和国高市郡に所在する桃花鳥田丘上陵（塚山古墳ともいう。）とする。
sen.e: In Engishiki (an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers), it is called Tsukita no okanoue no misasagi (also called Tsukayama kofun) located in Takaichi-gun, Yamato Province.

It has a shape of a round barrow with a diameter of 16 meters.

sen.j: 平安以降、所在が不明になり、幕末の天皇陵整理で、あるいは元禄以降、神武天皇陵と擬せられるが、明治にはいり明治11年、綏靖天皇陵に訂正治定され、改修された。
sen.e: As the location had been unknown since Heian period, it was likened to be the Mausoleum of Emperor Jinmu at the organization of imperial mausoleums at the end of Edo period, or from Genroku era, however, over Meiji period, it was revised and authorized to be the Mausoleum of Emperor Suizei, and repaired in 1878.
